question: Will the announcers say "Bitcoin" or "Crypto" during 49ers vs Rams game? (October 2)
description:
The San Francisco 49ers are scheduled to play the Los Angeles Rams on October 2, at 8:15 PM ET.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if either a play-by-play announcer or a color commentator says the listed term at any point between kickoff and the conclusion of this game during its primary official broadcast. Otherwise, the market will resolve to "No".

Mentions by sideline reporters, rules analysts, studio hosts, or any other on-air personnel who are not serving as play-by-play or color commentators will not count.

Any usage of the term regardless of context will count toward the resolution of this market.

Pluralization/possessive of the term will count toward the resolution of this market, however other forms will NOT count.

Instances where the term is used in a compound word will count regardless of context (e.g. joyful is not a compound word for "joy," however "killjoy" is a compounding of the words "kill" and "joy").

If this market requires a specified number of mentions of a person’s first or last name, a full-name mention will count as one mention (e.g., if a market is about “Joe / Biden 5+ times,” a mention of “Joe Biden” will count once).

If the start of this game is cancelled or otherwise delayed beyond October 3, 2025, 11:59 PM ET this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source for this market is the official NFL broadcast of this game.
